caption.title: Effect of mixing on the relative contribution of horizontal (W H) and vertical transmission (W V) to the fitness of the virulent mutant in the model.
caption.p:
Each curve corresponds to different levels of mixing: no mixing g
H = g
P = 0 (dotted line), intermediate mixing g
H = g
P = 0.5 (dashed line) and full mixing with g
H = g
P = 1 (full line). The contribution of horizontal transmission is maximal in the early stage of the epidemic because many susceptible hosts are still available. More mixing increases the contribution of horizontal transmission to the fitness of the mutant throughout the epidemics.
